isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - IDLE SHUTDOWN TIMER (IST) - FAULT DETECTION/MANAGEMENT

svcproc.title: FAULT DETECTION/MANAGEMENT
svcproc.para: The Idle Shutdown feature is internal to the ECM, all subsystems that input the idle shutdown strategy have their own fault detection and management strategy. (E.g. IAT temperature sensor circuit). A fault code will be set if the idle shutdown timer has been activated, but this is not a system fault. Its only purpose is to indicate to the technician, driver or owner that the idle shutdown timer has been activated and the engine has been shut down.

Refer to Figure 3.76
for the idle shutdown timer circuit diagram.

figure.caption: Figure 3.76 Idle Shutdown Timer Circuit Diagram

note.para: This fault code does not indicate any system or circuit faults, no DIAGNOSTICS are necessary. If the IST programming parameters need to be changed, see the following extended description.

entry.para: 324 = Idle shutdown time has been exceeded and engine has been shut down.
